body:
Comment 4 by **kenliz@cruzio.com**: 
This is not a very practical solution, since it prevents the main program from ever
exiting.

A better solution is what I posted on the go-lang nuts discussion, "defer statements in
go routines require 
synchronization to guarantee execution". In my solution, the first deferred statement
posts a "done" signal as 
its last effective statement. Then whether it actually gets to complete or not before
main is not much of an 
issue.

I'd be interested if you have any other ideas for a practical solution?
